cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico and expected to bend slightly north, reaching southeast Louisiana then turning northeast inland over Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana near the Houma/Grand Isle area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: No active watch at the port; earlier watches mainly east of the warning area
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lakes Pontchartrain and Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are very likely (97%); hurricane-force gusts possible (≈50% chance of 50-kt sustained, 26-50% chance of 64-kt gusts).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port location, though river levels may rise modestly from back-water effects.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rainfall possible, producing flash and river flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Sunday–Monday; prolonged power outages and disruption to ground transportation expected.
